oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Cart-de-visite of General Winfield Scott
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Scott was the General-in-Chief of the US Army at the beginning of the Civil War. He had served in the War of 1812, commanded the American invasion and capture of Mexico City in the Mexican War. He ran for president as a Whig twice losing both times. Scott also reluctantly oversaw the Indian Removal Policy in the 1830s resulting in the Trail of Tears.
